meanings.definition: The branch of psychology concerned with the measurement of mental traits and abilities.
meanings.sent1: In psychometries, psychologists study how people's minds work.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in psychometries analyze intelligence and personality traits.
meanings.sent3: The world of psychometries can reveal interesting insights into human behavior.
meanings.sent4: Exploring psychometries is like unraveling the mysteries of the mind.
meanings.sent5: The field of psychometries helps us understand what makes each person unique.

meanings.definition: The use of statistical methods to analyze psychological data.
meanings.sent1: Psychometries involves using numbers to understand behavior patterns.
meanings.sent2: In research, psychometries helps make sense of complex data sets.
meanings.sent3: Statisticians in psychometries are like detectives solving data mysteries.
meanings.sent4: The precision of psychometries can uncover hidden trends in psychology.
meanings.sent5: Through psychometries, psychologists can quantify human emotions and thoughts.

meanings.definition: The practice of measuring psychic abilities or phenomena.
meanings.sent1: Some believe in psychometries as a way to test psychic powers.
meanings.sent2: Psychometries explores the boundaries between science and the supernatural.
meanings.sent3: Using psychometries, one can attempt to measure the unexplained.
meanings.sent4: The realm of psychometries delves into the mysteries of the paranormal.
meanings.sent5: Practicing psychometries involves testing the limits of human perception.
